title: Kevin Clifton 'in denial' about early Strictly Come Dancing exit
text:
Kevin Clifton has admitted he's finding it tough coming to terms with his early exit from Strictly Come Dancing.

The reigning champion off the BBC series was kicked out of the competition on Sunday after his Charleston with Anneka Rice failed to impress the judges or the voting public.

Posting a video on Strictly's official Instagram account on Tuesday as they prepared to go on It Takes Two, Kevin and Anneka joked they are still practicing routines.

They're out! Kevin Clifton has admitted he's finding it tough coming to terms with his early exit from Strictly Come Dancing

Kevin, who has been rumoured to be fuming over his elimination, joked to the camera: 'I'm in denial that we're out actually, we've been practising all day.'

Anneka, 61, then chimed in: 'We'll do it in my sitting room on Friday and Kev and Stacey's sitting room on Saturday. You can come along and watch as well.'

A cheerful Kevin quipped: 'Tune in at the weekend,' before a video appeared of their last dance for Movies Week.

Still dancing! Posting a video on Strictly's official Instagram account on Tuesday as they prepared to go on It Takes Two, Kevin and Anneka joked they are still practicing routines

Early exit: Kevin, who has been rumoured to be fuming over his elimination, joked to the camera 'I'm in denial that we're out actually, we've been practising all day'

Anneka and Kevin exited the competition at the weekend, losing out in a dance-off with David James and Nadiya Bychkova.

Anneka also shared her own video on Tuesday while tweeting: 'Aw... we're feeling a bit bereft. (sic)'

She accompanied this with a clip of the pair backstage before their It Takes Two appearance, with the dance partners joking they would be performing the Paso Doble from Kevin's house this weekend because they wouldn't get to do the routine live on air.

Commiserations: The reigning champion off the BBC series was kicked out of the competition on Sunday after his Charleston with Anneka failed to impress viewers or the public

As Kevin joked about a live stream, Anneka laughed: 'Have you just felt sad today? We'd have done the Paso Doble... It's so sad. We're going to be positive though!

'We're going to carry on dancing and we're gonna do the Paso Doble. We're gonna do rehearsal in my sitting room on Friday, and then the full fantastic version in Kev's house on Saturday.'

During their appearance on 'It Takes Two' on Monday, Anneka also slammed the song she and Kevin had to dance to, 'Woo Hoo' by the 5. 6. 7. 8's.

Not destined for the Glitterball: The presenter, 61, and her pro dancer partner, 36, exited the competition after losing out in a dance-off with David James and Nadiya Bychkova

She said: 'Well to be honest that song, I never want to hear it again. All the other songs in movie week made your heart soar. 'I'm not surprised people couldn't vote for that. It did our head in in rehearsals.

Kevin insisted: 'It's like listening to an alarm clock 24/7.' Anneka agreed, adding: 'Sometimes it was like being in the middle of a roadworks.'

It comes after Kevin thanked Anneka following their elimination for her hard work during their three weeks together.

He wrote: 'Thank u @AnnekaRice for a lovely few weeks. You worked so hard and in a short space of time started dancing with your heart.

Farewell: Anneka also shared her own video on Tuesday while tweeting: 'Aw... we're feeling a bit bereft. (sic)'

'Good luck to all the other contestants. Its going to be a cracking @bbcstrictly series.'

Anneka, best know for her presenting roles on Treasure Hunt and Challenge Anneka - later returned the compliment by crediting Clifton following their exit.

'Well. That was like running away to the circus,' she added. 'What an adventure! Thank you everyone for your support and special love to @kevinclifton⁩ for unflinching loyalty & kindness.

'And patience like I've never seen! I've certainly discovered a new me.'

Clifton's girlfriend and fellow reigning champion Stacey Dooley, 32, also took to social media to throw her support behind the dancer.

Though he was gracious in defeat onscreen, The Sun reports that it was a different story backstage, with Clifton reportedly telling his fellow pros 'I told you so'.

Off she goes: Anneka thanked Kevin for his support after her Strictly exit

His alleged comments were in reference to his pre-series prediction that he would have difficulty in getting Anneka up to standard so they could go far in the competition.

A source told the publication: 'Kevin adores Anneka as a person but professionally he knew his chances of making another final were over, especially as she's struggled with injury and fitness.

'Going out in the second week was humiliating for him. In his eyes he's 'King Kev' – and he's done phenomenal routines with his previous partners.'

During his Strictly career, Kevin has been in every final (bar 2017) since he joined the show in 2013.

But despite his reported anger at being knocked out, the dancing star still has love for Anneka.

Claim: Though he was gracious in defeat onscreen, The Sun reports that it was a different story backstage, with Clifton reportedly telling his fellow pros 'I told you so'

The insider added: 'He's got a friend for life in Anneka and he loved working with her. But this series is one he wants to forget.'

MailOnline has contacted representatives for Strictly and Kevin for comment.

Sunday's results show saw The Challenge Anneka star, who celebrated her 61st birthday on Friday and came bottom of the leaderboard on Saturday, unanimously voted off.

As she learned of her fate with ballroom partner Kevin, the bubbly TV personality remained positive, telling show host Tess Daly: 'To be honest, I'd have saved David and Nadiya [Bychkova]. I've just loved this whole thing.'

'I've not one negative about the whole experience,' she continued as she stood beside her dance partner. 'We've worked really hard, I'm covered in bruises.'

Further acknowledging Kevin, she said: 'I love this man; it's been a joy to have that honour, that privilege of learning to dance. It's a whole new world to me, Tess. I love all that gang up there! Now I've got 11 and a half [dance] moves!

'My son is getting married next year, I'm determined to be able to shuffle onto the dance floor and not do my usual thing of handing out the canapes.'
description: Kevin Clifton has admitted he's finding it tough coming to terms with his early exit from Strictly Come Dancing.
